comments.body: Instead of `{}`, why not use an estree Node? (here and in other locations)

ESLint AST could not assign to `@types/estree` AST types, so I'd like to keep relax here.
(though I have ESLint AST definitions in my project local [vue-eslint-parser/src/ast/nodes.ts](https://github.com/mysticatea/vue-eslint-parser/blob/6111437a4b470fb63227099a69749a7ef2f022a4/src/ast/nodes.ts), I want to find why it cannot assign to estree types then I want to publish the definition to `@types/eslint`. But the type definition is recursive, so `tsc` doesn't show meaningful error :cry:)
`eslint-scope` uses those parameters as only the key of `Map`, so I think this relaxing does not trigger runtime errors.
